com.unvired.chyme.api

Class ChymeAPI

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.unvired.chyme.api.ChymeAPI

  • public class ChymeAPI
extends java.lang.Object
    ChymeAPI provides the mechanism for a Bot to both receive messages from a Chyme conversation and respond to the user with a suitable message.

    Bots can receive messages from two sources. 1. From Chyme users as Commands 2. From Enterprise System and External systems as Events

    All input to and output from a Bot is encapsulated as BusinessEntity objects. Command, Event, Recipe Context, Command Context all derive from BusinessEntity.

    Inputs to Bot

    • BusinessEntity - Input to a Command or an Event modelled in the Bots Buidler are internally realized as objects inheriting from BusinessEntity
    • SYS_CONTEXT - "Bot Attributes" defined in the Bots Builder are available as context attributes and can be retrieved using getRecipeContext() and getRecipeContext(String) methods
    • SYS_CUSTOM_EVENT - Events from an external system are available as WebEvent in the Bot function and can be retrieved using getWebEvent()
    • SYS_SALESFORCE_EVENT - Events from Salesforce.com are available as SalesforceEvent in the Bot function and can be retrieved using getSalesforceEvent()
    • SYS_SAP_EVENT - Events from SAP are available as SAPEvent in the Bot function and can be retrieved using getSAPEvent()

    Outputs from Bot

    • BusinessEntity - Output from a Command or an Event modelled in the Bots Builder are also realized as objects inheriting from BusinessEntity. The function addBE(BusinessEntity) helps collect response BusinessEntity.
    • SYS_MESSAGE - Message is a simplified version of SYS_MESSAGE. This represents the response from the Bot and is set using setMessage(Message)
    • SYS_CHART - Chart is a simplified version of SYS_CHART. The Bot uses this to send one or more charts as response using addChart(Chart)
    • SYS_HTML - Bots use the function addHTML(String) to return a HTML response
    • SYS_MEDIA - Bots use the function addMedia(File, String) to attach a file as a response
    • SYS_TAG - Bots use the function setTags(String, String) to associate upto two values to help trace a Bot call for debugging purposes

    Author:
    Unvired Inc

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ChymeAPI.ResultStatus
      Value to describe the overall status of the response from a Bot SUSSESS - Indicates that the Bot was able to handle the message successfully FAILURE - Indicates that there was functional error in processing the message RETRY - Indicates that there was a technical error in processing the message and that the user should retry the message

      • getRecipeContext

        public java.util.Properties getRecipeContext()
        Returns the Bot Attributes as (Key,Value) pairs.

        Recipe context refers to the attributes that are defined in the Bots Builder under the "Bot Attributes" section. The values for these attributes can be set at the time of activating Bots in the Chyme web application.

        The Bot can use the attribute values at the time of execution to acquire relevant context when executing business logic.

      • getRecipeContext

        public java.lang.String getRecipeContext(java.lang.String propertyName)
        Returns the value of a named Bot Attribute
        Parameters:
        propertyName - Name of the attribute
